No one answers my questions I believe that you will answer this question.

What is the difference in meaning which one is more correct and commonly used in English


The teacher explained a lesson to the students, showing a picture.

The teacher explained a lesson, to the students by showing a picture.

I am not sure when to add the preposition by to an ing clausee😢😢

Reply: 'The teacher explained a lesson to the students by showing a picture' is the correct sentence. We can use 'by' + gerund to explain how we do something eg 'I learnt English by practising every day'.
